intro: Oxalis conferta, commonly known as the common wood sorrel, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is a small, herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 10–20 centimeters. The plant features trifoliate leaves with heart-shaped lobes and produces clusters of small, yellow flowers. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade. Oxalis conferta is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to care for in gardens.
